notes: T (26.7%) is the dominant category — expected given current AI/quantum breakthroughs cycle.
s (spiritual) at 6.7% is the weakest category, but was improved from 0% via source exploration.
Source exploration successfully addressed E_Economic gap (8% -> 13.3%) and s_spiritual gap (0% -> 6.7%).
Ideal uniform distribution would be 16.7% per category. T and P are over-represented; s is under-represented.
No category is at 0%, which is a quality improvement over prior scans.
steeps_distribution.skew_index_method: variance of category ratios from uniform (0.167)

field_quality_notes.추론: STRONG — all signals include forward-looking reasoning with cross-signal connections (e.g., rank 2+5 quantum convergence, rank 1+4 policy-market decoupling). Depth is significantly improved vs known W4 weakness.

field_quality_notes.모니터링_지표: All present. Actionable monitoring indicators provided.

notes: 80% of signals cluster in the 80-89 range — moderate score compression persists (known W2 weakness).
Range of 13 points (77-90) is acceptable but narrow.
CRITICAL tier (90+) has only 1 signal, suggesting the threshold effectively discriminates extreme signals.
No scores below 77 in top 15, meaning the HIGH threshold effectively separates top signals.
Score compression is partially structural: all top-15 signals ARE genuinely high-impact current events.
Consider: pSST weight rebalancing to spread the 80-89 cluster. SR and ES weights could be differentiated more.

parameter_tuning_suggestions.rationale: Increasing Signal Reliability weight slightly could help spread the 80-89 cluster by differentiating signals with stronger/weaker source backing. However, this requires sum rebalancing.

parameter_tuning_suggestions.rationale: s_spiritual is at 6.7% (below 10%). A lower gap threshold would trigger exploration for categories under 10% rather than 15%, potentially finding more s-category signals earlier.
parameter_tuning_suggestions.action: DEFER — first SIE run, need more data points to validate effectiveness of current threshold.

overall_assessment.summary: WF1 report for 2026-02-13 demonstrates strong quality across all dimensions. All 15 top signals have complete 9-field coverage. STEEPs distribution is improved via source exploration (no 0% categories). Cross-impact analysis shows genuine analytical depth with 6 pairs and original conceptual frameworks. Known weaknesses W1, W6, W7 are fully resolved. W2 (pSST compression) persists at moderate level. W3 and W4 are significantly improved. Source exploration is functioning effectively with 2 promotion-worthy candidates identified.
top_strengths: Source exploration successfully remediated STEEPs gaps
Cross-impact analysis quality significantly improved with original concepts
Signal evolution tracking (Section 3) shows good day-over-day continuity
Scenarios include probability assessments and are logically grounded
areas_for_improvement: pSST score compression (80% in 80-89 range) — consider dimension weight rebalancing
s (spiritual) category still underrepresented at 6.7% — continue gap-directed exploration
Geographic balance noted as 'moderate' — US/Europe heavy, Asia/Africa/Latin America underrepresented
Iran signal (rank 9) cross-impact with energy/trade is somewhat formulaic compared to other pairs

meta.reason_for_deferral: SIE config requires min_workflow_history >= 3 before acting. This is run 1 of 3 needed.
meta.next_action: Continue collecting SIE baselines for 2 more runs before applying any parameter changes.
